methods.description: Use this call to get a list of payments in any state (created, approved, failed, etc.). The payments returned are the payments made to the merchant making the call.
Create a payment
Use this call to get details about payments that have not completed, such as payments that are created and approved, or if a payment has failed.

Use this call to execute (complete) a PayPal payment that has been approved by the payer. You can optionally update transaction information when executing the payment by passing in one or more transactions.

TransactionId.name: TransactionId
TransactionId.description: Pass the sale id in the endpoint.

methods.description: Use this call to get details about a sale transaction.
Use this call to refund a completed payment. Provide the sale_id in the URI and an empty JSON payload for a full refund. For partial refunds, you can include an amount.
Use this call to get details about a specific refund.
Use this call to get details about a captured payment.
Use this call to refund a captured payment. Provide the captureId in the URI and an amount object. For partial refunds, you can include a lower amount object.

status.name: status
status.description: Pass created, active, or inactive in the URI path to request billings plans in the CREATED, ACTIVE, or INACTIVE states respectively.

methods.description: Use this call to get a list of all billing plans based on their current state: created, active, or deactivated.
Use this call to create a billing plan. The request sample shows the plan being created with a regular billing period.
Use this call to get details about a specific billing plan.

200.description: Returns the HTTP status of 200 if the call is successful.

methods.description: You can update the information for an existing billing plan. The state of a plan must be active before a billing agreement is created.
Use this call to create a billing agreement for the buyer.
Use this call to execute an agreement after the buyer approves it.
Use this call to retrieve an agreement.

200.description: Returns the HTTP status of 200 if the call is successful.

methods.description: Use this call to update an agreement.

204.description: Returns the HTTP status of 204 if the call is successful.

methods.description: Use this call to suspend an agreement.

204.description: Returns the HTTP status of 204 if the call is successful.

methods.description: Use this call to reactivate an agreement.
Use this call to cancel an agreement.

204.description: Returns the HTTP status of 204 if the call is successful.

methods.description: Use this call to bill the outstanding amount of an agreement.

204.description: Returns the HTTP status of 204 if the call is successful.

methods.description: Use this call to set the outstanding amount of an agreement.
Use this call to search for the transactions within a billing agreement.
Specify an order ID to get details about an order.
Use this call to authorize an order.
Use this call to capture a payment on an order. To use this call, an original payment call must specify an intent of order.
se this call to void an existing order.
Use this call to get details about authorizations.
Use this resource to capture and process a previously created authorization. To use this resource, the original payment call must have the intent set to authorize.
Use this call to void a previously authorized payment.
Pass the authorization id in the endpoint along with a new authorization object if you need to authorize a different amount.
Use this call to store credit card details with PayPal.
Use this call to look up details of a credit card. Simply include the credit card id in the request URI.
Use this call to delete details of a credit card. Simply include the credit card id in the request URI.
Use this call to modify a credit card.

grant_type.name: grant_type
grant_type.description: Token grant type. Value must be set to authorization_code

code.name: code
code.description: Authorization code previously received from the authorization server.

redirect_uri.name: redirect_uri
redirect_uri.description: Redirection endpoint that must match the one provided during the authorization request that ended in receiving the authorization code.

methods.description: Use this call to grant a new access token, using the previously obtained authorization code.

schema.name: schema
schema.description: Pass the schema that is used to return as per openidconnect protocol. The only supported schema value is openid.

methods.description: Use this call to retrieve user profile attributes.
Returns invoices that belong to the merchant who makes the call.
Creates an invoice in a draft state. After you create an invoice that includes an items array, you can send the invoice.
Returns the specified invoice.
Makes the specified changes to the specified invoice.
Deletes a draft invoice. Note that this call works for invoices in the draft state only.

width.name: width
width.description: The width of the QR code image, in pixels. Range of 150 to 500.

height.name: height
height.description: The height of the QR code image, in pixels. Range of 150 to 500.

action.name: action
action.description: The type of URL for which a QR code is provided. The only supported value is pay, which is the default value.

methods.description: Specify an invoice ID to get a QR code (image) that corresponds to the invoice ID.

202.description: Returns an HTTP response message with status code 202 (Accepted).

methods.description: Sends the specified invoice to the payer. An invoice cannot be sent unless it includes an items array.

202.description: Returns an HTTP response message with status code 202 (Accepted).

methods.description: Sends a reminder that a payment is due for an existing invoice.

202.description: Returns an HTTP response message with status code 202 (Accepted).

methods.description: Cancels an invoice and (optionally) notifies the payer of the cancellation.
Use this call to mark an invoice as paid.
Use this call to mark an invoice as refunded.
Returns invoices that match the specified criteria.
